meanings.definition: Relating to the analysis of small or minute details.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a microanalytical approach to study the tiny cells.
meanings.sent2: Her microanalytical skills helped her notice the smallest errors in the data.
meanings.sent3: The detective's microanalytical eye spotted the minuscule clue hidden in the room.
meanings.sent4: His microanalytical mind could dissect complex problems into manageable parts.
meanings.sent5: The artist's microanalytical vision captured the intricate patterns in nature.

meanings.definition: Involving the examination of tiny components or particles.
meanings.sent1: The microanalytical tools allowed for precise measurement of the small particles.
meanings.sent2: The microanalytical study focused on analyzing the minute structures of the material.
meanings.sent3: The microanalytical investigation revealed the hidden details in the sample.
meanings.sent4: Her microanalytical approach to the experiment uncovered unexpected results.
meanings.sent5: The microanalytical examination showed the intricate composition of the substance.
